modlee.config module

modlee.converter module

modlee.data_metafeatures module

modlee.data_stats module

modlee.exp_loss_logger module

Log several different losses for an experiment.

extract_loss_functions(code_str: str)[source]

Extracts unique loss function calls from ModleeModel class definition passed as string

Parameters:

code_str – The Python code string to analyze.

Returns:

A list of unique loss function calls found in the code.

get_exp_loss_for_model(module)[source]

Get a list of loss functions used in a given model. NOTE Assumption that loss function is called in __init__ or training_step

Parameters:

module – The model to analyze.

Returns:

A list of unique loss function calls found in the model.

modlee.loss_sweeper module

modlee.model module

modlee.model_text_converter module

Convertor for model objects into text (deprecated?).

exhaust_sequence_branch(root_sequence_module, custom_history)[source]

Exhaust a module as a tree to find custom modules,

Parameters:

  • root_sequence_module – The root node/module of the model.

  • custom_history – A list of custom module names.

Returns:

A tuple of lists ([custom module objects], [custom module names])

get_code_text(code_text, module, custom_history)[source]

Get a code text representation of a model as its __init__ and forward functions. TODO - this only saves a hardcoded subset of functions

Parameters:

  • code_text – The current code text if there are other dependencies, can be empty ‘’.

  • module – The module for which to get the code text.

  • custom_history – A list of the history of custom modules.

Returns:

A tuple of code_text, custom_child_module_list, custom_history.

get_code_text_for_model(model: Module | LightningModule, include_header=False)[source]

Get the code text for a model.

Parameters:

model – The model for which to get the code text.

Returns:

The code text for the model.

save_code_text_for_model(code_text: str, include_header: bool = False)[source]

Save the code text.

Parameters:

  • code_text – The code text to save.

  • include_header – Whether to include the header of modlee imports in the text, defaults to False.

modlee.modlee_image_model module

modlee.retriever module

Retriever for experiment assets.

get_cached_vars(run_path)[source]

Get the cached variables required to rebuild a model from a run path.

Parameters:

run_path – The run path.

Returns:

A dictionary of the cached variables.

get_data_snapshot(run_path)[source]

Get the saved data snapshot from a run path.

Parameters:

run_path – The run path.

Returns:

The data snapshot as a numpy array.

get_model(run_path)[source]

Get the model at a run path.

Parameters:

run_path – The run path.

Returns:

The model as a ModleeModel object.

get_runs(run_path, experiment_id=None, run_id=None, **kwargs)[source]

Get the runs in a given run path.

Parameters:

  • run_path – The path to search.

  • experiment_id – The experiment ID to retrieve, defaults to None and retrieves all experiments.

  • run_id – The run ID to retrieve, defaults to None to retrieves all runs.

Returns:

A list of runs.

run_path_exists(run_path)[source]

Chek if a run path exists.

Parameters:

run_path – The run path to check.

Returns:

Whether the path exists or not.

modlee.utils module

Utility functions.

apply_discretize_to_summary(text, info)[source]

Discretize a summary.

Parameters:

  • text – The text to discretize.

  • info – An object that contains different separators.

Returns:

The discretized summary.

closest_power_of_2(x)[source]

Round a number to its closest power of 2, i.e. y = 2**floor(log_2(x)).

Parameters:

x – The number.

Returns:

The closest power of 2 of the number.

convert_to_scientific(x)[source]

Convert a number to scientific notation.

Parameters:

x – The number to convert.

Returns:

The number in scientific notation as a string.

discretize(n: list[float, int]) → list[float, int][source]

Discretize a list of inputs

Parameters:

n – The list of inputs to discretize.

Returns:

The list of discretized inputs.

get_fashion_mnist(batch_size=64)[source]

Get the Fashion MNIST dataset from torchvision.

Parameters:

batch_size – The batch size, defaults to 64.

Returns:

A tuple of train and test dataloaders.

get_model_size(model, as_MB=True)[source]

Get the size of a model, as estimated from the number and size of its parameters.

Parameters:

  • model – The model for which to get the size.

  • as_MB – Whether to return the size in MB, defaults to True.

Returns:

The model size.

is_cacheable(x)[source]

Check if an object is cacheable / serializable.

Parameters:

x – The object to check cacheability, probably a dictionary.

Returns:

A boolean of whether the object is cacheable or not.

quantize(x)[source]

Quantize an object.

Parameters:

x – The object to quantize.

Returns:

The object, quantized.

quantize_dict(base_dict, quantize_fn=<function quantize>)[source]

Quantize a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • base_dict – The dictionary to quantize.

  • quantize_fn – The function to use for quantization, defaults to quantize.

Returns:

The quantized dictionary.

safe_mkdir(target_path)[source]

Safely make a directory.

Parameters:

target_path – The path to the target directory.

save_run(modlee_client, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Save the current run.

Parameters:

modlee_client – The client object that is tracking the current run.

typewriter_print(text, sleep_time=0.001, max_line_length=150, max_lines=20)[source]

Print a string letter-by-letter, like a typewriter.

Parameters:

  • text – The text to print.

  • sleep_time – The time to sleep between letters, defaults to 0.001.

  • max_line_length – The maximum line length to truncate to, defaults to 150.

  • max_lines – The maximum number of lines to print, defaults to 20.

uri_to_path(uri)[source]

Convert a URI to a path.

Parameters:

uri – The URI to convert.

Returns:

The converted path.
